verses.name: Hebrews 13:1
verses.text: Let brotherly love continue.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:2
verses.text: Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:3
verses.text: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:4
verses.text: Marriage is honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:5
verses.text: Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:6
verses.text: So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:7
verses.text: Remember them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto you the word of God: whose faith follow, considering the end of their conversation.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:8
verses.text: Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:9
verses.text: Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For it is a good thing that the heart be established with grace; not with meats, which have not profited them that have been occupied therein.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:10
verses.text: We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve the tabernacle.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:11
verses.text: For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest for sin, are burned without the camp.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:12
verses.text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:13
verses.text: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:14
verses.text: For here have we no continuing city, but we seek one to come.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:15
verses.text: By him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to his name.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:16
verses.text: But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:17
verses.text: Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:18
verses.text: Pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honestly.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:19
verses.text: But I beseech you the rather to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:20
verses.text: Now the God of peace, that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant,

verses.name: Hebrews 13:21
verses.text: Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:22
verses.text: And I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for I have written a letter unto you in few words.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:23
verses.text: Know ye that our brother Timothy is set at liberty; with whom, if he come shortly, I will see you.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:24
verses.text: Salute all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.

verses.name: Hebrews 13:25
verses.text: Grace be with you all. Amen.  Written to the Hebrews from Italy by Timothy.
